current_title: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

general_points.string: Failed to declare £52,723 of his income in December 2018
11 months late in registering his 20% share in a property in Somerset

As mayor of London, he assured the public that policing numbers would go up, which it did. In London figures rose from 31,460 to 32,125 (+/- 719) between March 2008 and March 2016. However, over the same time period, numbers fell across England and Wales by 17,603.
As Mayor during the 2011 London Riots, it took him 3 days to return to the UK from his holiday in Canada
Claimed that ‘Boris bikes’ would be ‘at no cost to the taxpayer’. Each cost taxpayers £1,400 - 2013
Said President Barack Obama removed a bust of Winston Churchill because of his ‘ancestral dislike of the British empire’, and referred to him as ‘part-Kenyan’.

Lied by stating that British Iranian national Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe, jailed in Iran, was there teaching journalists when she was detained. A claim made against her official statement of being there on holiday. A claim supported by her family and employer.
Payed to total of £322,000 for 3 illegal water cannons after the 2014 riots

russian_connections.string: Russian diplomat Sergey Nalobin (whose father Nikolai was a former KGB general, and has links to the Russian FSB) was pictured with Boris (then London mayor), calling him a 'good friend'

Boris (then UK Foreign Secretary) is seen pictured with Joseph Mifsud, whome allegedly has links with high-level Russians and has been missing since April 2019. US federal investigators believe that Mifsud was the "go-between" for Donald Trump and Russia.

Lubov Chernukhin donated £200,000 to Johnson's Conservative Party election campaign in its first week. Mrs. Chernukhin is the wife of Russian oligarch Vladimir Chernukhin. She had previously paid £160,000 for a tennis match with Boris, and £135,000 for a dinner with former Prime Minister Theresa May.
The night after his election win, he was pictured at a party with Alexander Lebedev (a former KGB officer, and a Russian oligarch) and pictured with his son Evgeny.
The British Government, under Boris Johnson, awarded the son of a former KGB officer, Evgeny Lebedev a lifetime peerage in the House of Lords.

quotes.string: "Just pat her on the bottom and send her on her way."
quotes.substring: Boris Johnson on Kimberly Quinn, then publisher for The Spectator in 1995

quotes.string: "The real reason why Blackpool is buzzing with glamorous women is surely that they scent victory. It is not the great smell of Brut that makes John Prescott attractive. It is the whiff of power with the fickleness of their sex, they are following the polls."
quotes.substring: Boris Johnson on why women are voting Labour in 1996

quotes.string: 'Weep, O ye shirt-makers of Jermyn Street, ye Cool Brittania tailors and whatever exists of human finer feeling, In the Ministry of Sound, the tank-topped bum boys blub into their Pils.'
quotes.substring: Boris Johnson on Peter Mandelson’s resignation in 1998

quotes.string: "Across the country, there are many Tories who wish their party leadership would speak up more strongly against, say, gays in the military, or the cowing of the police by the Macpherson report, or the arrest of General Pinochet, or the impending abolition of the oath and the cap badge of the RUC, or the abolition of the hereditary peers and foxhunting. They are, of course, right
quotes.substring: Boris Johnson, Spectator magazine in 2000"

quotes.string: "We don’t want our children being taught some rubbish about homosexual marriage being the same as normal marriage"
quotes.substring: Boris Johnson on Section 28 in Daily Telegraph, 2000

quotes.string: "Labours appalling agenda, encouraging the teachings of homosexuality in schools, and the rest of it."
quotes.substring: Boris Johnson on the introduction of teaching about homosexuality in schools, in 2000

quotes.string: "If gay marriage was OK - then I saw no reason in principle why a union should not be consecrated between three men, as well as two men; or indeed three men and a dog"
quotes.substring: Boris Johnson wrote in his book - Friends, Voters, Countrymen, 2001

quotes.string: "If left to their own devices, the natives would rely on nothing but the instant carbohydrate gratification of the plantain"
quotes.substring: Boris Johnson on Uganda on 2nd February 2002 - Spectator

quotes.string: "The continent may be a blot, but it is not a blot upon our conscience. The problem is not that we were once in charge, but that we are not in charge anymore"
quotes.substring: Boris Johnson on Africa in 2nd February 2002 - Spectator

quotes.string: "What a relief it must be for Blair to get out of England. It is said that the Queen has come to love the Commonwealth, partly because it supplies her with regular cheering crowds of flag-waving piccaninnies."
quotes.substring: Boris Johnson in 2002 - Telegraph

quotes.string: "No doubt the AK47s will fall silent and the pangas will stop their hacking of human flesh, and the tribal warriors will all break out in watermelon smiles to see the big white chief touch down in his big white British taxpayer-funded bird"
quotes.substring: Boris Johnson on Tony Blair's visit to the Congo in 2002

quotes.string: "The minority tyranny of apartheid... followed by the majority tyranny of black rule"
quotes.substring: Boris Johnson on South Africa in 2003

quotes.string: "Right, let’s go and look at some more piccaninnies"
quotes.substring: Boris Johnson while in Uganda to Rod Liddle, Swedish Unicef workers and their black driver in 2003

quotes.string: "It is complete balderdash. It is an inverted pyramid of piffle. It is all completely untrue and ludicrous conjecture. I am amazed people can write this drivel."
quotes.substring: Boris Johnson lying about his affair with Petronella Wyatt in 2004

quotes.string: "Voting Tory will cause your wife to have bigger breasts and increase your chances of owning a BMW M3."
quotes.substring: Boris Johnson during election campaign for Henley in 2005

quotes.string: "It will take a huge effort of courage and skill to win round the many thousands of British Muslims who are in a similar state of alienation, and to make them see that their faith must be compatible with British values and with loyalty to Britain. That means disposing of the first taboo, and accepting that the problem is Islam. Islam is the problem."
quotes.substring: Boris Johnson, The Spectator - Just don't call it war, 16 July 2005

quotes.string: "To any non-Muslim reader of the Koran, Islamophobia - fear of Islam - seems a natural reaction, and, indeed, exactly what that text is intended to provoke. Judged purely on its scripture - to say nothing of what is preached in the mosques - it Is the most viciously sectarian of all religions in the heartlessness towards unbelievers."
quotes.substring: Boris Johnson, The Spectator - Just don't call it war, 16 July 2005

quotes.string: "They wipe out cyclists, there are many cyclists killed every year by them."
quotes.substring: Boris Johnson lying about bendy buses in 2007

quotes.string: "Hypocrisy is at the heart of our national character"
quotes.substring: Boris Johnson in 2008

quotes.string: ‘Let’s give our NHS the £350 million the EU takes every week’
quotes.substring: Famous lie on the side of a bus

quotes.string: "It is absolutely ridiculous that people should choose to go around looking like letter boxes."
quotes.substring: Boris Johnson on Muslim women wearing the burqa

quotes.string: Calling children of single mothers, "a generation of ill-raised, ignorant, aggressive, and illegitimate children"
quotes.substring: Boris Johnson, The Spectator, 19th August 1995

quotes.string: 'If he is blue collar, he is likely to be drunk, criminal, aimless, feckless and hopeless, and perhaps claiming to suffer from low self-esteem'
quotes.substring: Boris Johnson on the working class, The Spectator, 19th August 1995

quotes.string: "For 10 years we in the Tory Party have become used to Papua New Guinea-style orgies of cannibalism and chief-killing, and so it is with a happy amazement that we watch as the madness engulfs the Labour Party"
"They've got to find men to marry"
quotes.substring: Boris Johnson on why the female percentile intake for Malaysias university is 68%, in 2013

quotes.string: "They’ve got a brilliant vision to turn Sirte, with the help of the municipality of Sirte, to turn it into the next Dubai. The only thing they've got to do is clear the dead bodies away and then we’ll be there"
quotes.substring: Boris Johnson on Libya in 2017

previous_titles: Banker for the Bank of England and Hong Kong

general_points.string: Made false statements on national television in the House of Commons, saying that Jeremy Corbyn did not vote for the Good Friday Agreement. In fact, Mr. Corbyn did, and Mr. Mogg did not.
Said that the surge in food banks showed "what a good compassionate country we are". Said in some cases the government cannot provide for those that need, so it's 'uplifting' to see charitable work.
Profits from the sale of abortion pills.
Blamed the Grenfell victims for their own deaths. Saying that despite orders from firefighters to remain, they should have used 'common sense' and attempted to flee.
Issued a 'style guide' for his staff dictating how to write and speak, including banning the use of some words, such as: Very, Equal, Unacceptable, Lot, Got, Speculate, Meet with, Ascertain, ...
Violated Coronavirus restriction rules to attend mass.
Failed to implement a voting system that is covid safe for MPs.
Attended a dinner hosted by a supporter of the far-right.

quotes.string: "I think it's a real scandal that Unicef should be playing politics in this way when it is meant to be looking after people in the poorest, the most deprived countries in the world, where people are starving, where there are famines and where there are civil wars."
quotes.substring: Shaming Unicef for feeding hungry, poverty-stricken children in London

quotes.string: "And instead of this endless carping, saying it’s difficult to get them, we should actually celebrate this phenomenal success of the British nation in getting up to a quarter of a million tests of a disease that nobody knew about until earlier in the year."
quotes.substring: Attacks 'endless carping' about Covid testing shortages in 2020

quotes.string: "the county of Somerset as defined by the Lieutenants Act shall revert to the customary time used prior to the Great Western Railway time established in 1840"
quotes.substring: Advocating for the county of Somerset to have it's own timezone in 2012

quotes.string: "...the People's Republic of Jam Jar or something"
quotes.substring: Refering to an African country, at the Conservative Party Conference in 2008

quotes.string: "Pakistanis, living in England? They're not in a class by nature of where they've come from."
quotes.substring: In an interview with Ali G in 1999
